R: @aaltay ready to be merged.
Thanks @jbonofre  @xumingming !
Run Java JDK Versions Test
Run Seed Job

Hmm, I'm surprised that the Cassandra and ES tests in hadoop/inputformat do not include scripts for generating the data, that seems problematic. @ssisk , do you know what's up with that?

However, the original intention of those Cassandra and ES tests was to validate HadoopInputFormatIO itself, which is not the case of your PR (the intention of your PR is simply to demonstrate how to use it with HiveIO, correct?)

The substantial part of your PR, relevant to people who want to use Beam with Hive, is the `getConfiguration` method and `myValueTranslate`. I'm wondering if perhaps the proper place for the code in this PR is a StackOverflow question with a self-answer (perhaps linking to a gist), rather than code committed to the Beam repo?

E.g. you could post a question "How do I read from Hive using Apache Beam?" and self-answer it with the `getConfiguration` snippet. What do you think?

Totally reasonable. This can be improved by passing `delimeter=/` when there is no recursive wildcard present. Even though this code filters correctly, the API returns way more data than necessary.

Thank you @wtanaka. Would not this rename be a breaking change in the stable API? Per the email thread responses, these could be introduced as new APIs instead (https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/9fb27e070b2038b5380dbff224a99c718790f6a3d42d51d9f84640eb@%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E).
Rebased and added more control on the Cassandra cluster builder: authentication, load balancing policy, consistency level.

```

```

```
BeamSqlFunctionBinaryExpression.java
BeamSqlFunctionBinaryExpressionTest.java
```

Even though the tests aren't running quite right, I think we are already in that state so it shouldn't block this. I'll merge it and then we can move forward with getting the `ValidatesRunner` tests fixed.

JIRA - BEAM-1158, reported by @iemejia looks for Hive support on Apache Beam and after discussion with @iemejia we decided to try HadoopInputFormatIO to read from Hive.
I believe we should have this one in both Apache Beam repo ( as an example ) and Stackoverflow post, what do you think ?

Great. Looks good to me. I'll squash and merge. There are some cleanups we can do later, like moving all the implementation into `verifyCompatibility` so that every override of `isCompatible` is just a tiny stub, and make sure the method is not called anywhere in the SDK.
Thanks. This requires a little fixup in FormatPayloadUsingCoder - I'll do that myself and merge.

LGTM as-is to get the job done. But can we also perhaps use a `@Rule` to clean up the table that is created?

The entire cluster is torn down after the test, I do not think this is
needed.

wrote:

> created?

Yea, not mandatory, just a bit better.

+1. It is a good idea.

I'd really rather setup and teardown the entire cluster after each test, but after a little playing that adds ~5-10s per unit test in the file. Similarly, deleting all tables after each test would add a few seconds per unit test in the file.

Hmm.
Definitely not worth seconds on test time.

Filed https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3181 to fix `WindowingTest#testNonPartitioningWindowing`. Strangely, I cannot reproduce the other two locally.

re: "I'm surprised that the Cassandra and ES tests in hadoop/inputformat do not include scripts for generating the data, that seems problematic. @ssisk ,"

these do include scripts for generating data - see https://github.com/apache/beam/tree/master/.test-infra/kubernetes - look for data-load.sh files under that directory

I skimmed this quickly, will provide better comments tomorrow, but I agree with the general sentiment that we should not add tests for everything that HIFIO can be used with.

I *do* think it'd be great to add comments to HIFIO's readme, but apparently that got removed in https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/1f631eb9f02c32f1a78712dcfb5c1bba9c9d4e93 so we'll have to figure out a place for that to live. cc @aaltay

The only comment i have is: the dataType of the table seems inferable from the rows? Quote from `BaseBeamTable`:

```java
  public BaseBeamTable(RelProtoDataType protoRowType) {
    this.relDataType = protoRowType.apply(BeamQueryPlanner.TYPE_FACTORY); // table dataType
    this.beamSqlRecordType = BeamSQLRecordType.from(relDataType); // rowDataType
  }
```

Do you mean the parameter of 
```
public BeamPCollectionTable(PCollection<BeamSQLRow> upstream, RelProtoDataType protoRowType)
```
?
`PCollection<BeamSQLRow>` itself doesn't return value of field `BeamSQLRow.dataType`, though it can be known when processing records. This schema information is required for Calcite to validate query, I suppose we need to pass it to the construction method.
